intro: Erithalis orbiculata, commonly known as the roundleaf erithalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas. It has a low-growing habit and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is also known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
